official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for the tax treatment of ABLE accounts
			 established under State programs for the care of family members with
			 disabilities, and for other purposes.

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Achieving a Better Life Experience Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Achieving a Better Life Experience Act of 2014

text.#text: The purposes of this Act are as follows:

To encourage and assist individuals and families in saving private funds for the purpose of
			 supporting individuals with disabilities to maintain health, independence,
			 and quality of life.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the supplemental security income program under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
title XIX
			 of the Social Security Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the beneficiary’s employment, and other sources.

text.#text:
To provide secure funding for disability-related expenses on behalf of designated beneficiaries
			 with disabilities that will supplement, but not supplant, benefits
			 provided through private insurance, the Medicaid program under

text.#text:
A qualified ABLE program shall be exempt from taxation under this subtitle. Notwithstanding the
			 preceding sentence, such program shall be subject to the taxes imposed by

A program shall not be treated as a qualified ABLE program unless it provides separate accounting
			 for each designated beneficiary.

A program shall not be treated as a qualified ABLE program unless it provides that any contributor
			 to, or designated beneficiary under, such program may not directly or
			 indirectly direct the investment of any contributions to the program (or
			 any earnings thereon).

A program shall not be treated as a qualified ABLE program if it allows any interest in the program
			 or any portion thereof to be used as security for a loan.

text.#text:
Any distribution under a qualified ABLE program shall be includible in the gross income of the
			 distributee in the manner as provided under

do not exceed the qualified disability expenses of the designated beneficiary, no amount shall be
			 includible in gross income, and

in any other case, the amount otherwise includible in gross income shall be reduced by an amount

For purposes of this paragraph, if distributions from a qualified ABLE program—

Subparagraph (A) shall not apply to any amount paid or distributed from an ABLE account to the
			 extent that the amount received is paid, not later than the 60th day after
			 the date of such payment or distribution, into another ABLE account for
			 the benefit of the same beneficiary or an eligible individual who is a
			 family member of the beneficiary.

Any change in the designated beneficiary of an interest in a qualified ABLE program during a
			 taxable year shall not be treated as a distribution for purposes of
			 subparagraph (A) if the new beneficiary is an eligible individual for such
			 taxable year and a member of the family of the former beneficiary.

Clause (i) shall not apply to any transfer if such transfer occurs within 12 months from the date
			 of a previous transfer to any qualified ABLE program for the benefit of
			 the designated beneficiary.

Any contribution to a qualified ABLE program on behalf of any designated beneficiary—

Except as provided in subparagraph (C), in no event shall a distribution from a qualified ABLE
			 program be treated as a taxable gift.

The taxes imposed by chapters 12 and 13 shall apply to a transfer by reason of a change in the
			 designated beneficiary under the program (or a contribution under
			 paragraph (1)(C) to the ABLE account of a new beneficiary) during any
			 taxable year unless, as of the beginning of such taxable year, the new
			 beneficiary is both an eligible individual for such taxable year and a
			 member of the family of the former beneficiary.

header.#text: Treatment of designation of new beneficiary

text.#text:
The tax imposed by this chapter for any taxable year on any taxpayer who receives a distribution
			 from a qualified ABLE program which is includible in gross income shall be
			 increased by 10 percent of the amount which is so includible.

Subparagraph (A) shall not apply if the payment or distribution is made to a beneficiary (or to the
			 estate of the designated beneficiary) on or after the death of the
			 designated beneficiary.

continuation-text.#text:
Any net income described in clause (ii) shall be included in gross income for the taxable year in
			 which such excess contribution was made.

text.#text:
If, during any taxable year of an eligible individual for whose benefit any ABLE account is
			 established, more than 1 ABLE account for the benefit of the eligible
			 individual exists at the same time, each such ABLE account other than the
			 earliest established ABLE account shall not be treated as an ABLE account
			 as of the first day of such taxable year.
